folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
449 to 445 Washington Street, east side, between Watts and Desbrosses Streets, as seen through a vacant lot at the S.W. corner of Watts Street. The latter has recently been cleared and was the site of three buildings, numbered 454 to 450 Washington Street.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Washington Street, west side, north from and including Watts Street and showing an empty lot at the S.W. corner of same; formerly the site of Nos. 450 to 454. Across this appears a new 1-story freight station of the Erie Railroad. The latter is at the N.W. corner; a vacant lot in
1922.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view slightly north of the vantage point for No. 1. Note the W.P.A. surface car track removal program under operation. Crosstown traffic seen in the midground is upon Canal Street.

April 29, 1937.

W. P. A. photo.
5 Boroughs Project.

folder: Washington Street & Watts Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Washington Street, south from Watts Street, showing a W.P.A. track removal project. The block shown in the foreground extends onto Watts and Desbrosses Streets.

April 28, 1937

W.P.A.Photo
Five Boroughs Project

folder: Watts Street & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
142 and 140-136 Watts Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Washington Street. The 5-story tenement shown at the corner also bears No. 457 Washington Street.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Watts Street & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Watts Street, south side, west from Washington to West Streets, showing NOS. 149 to 157 standing after the demolition at the S.W. corner of Washington Street. This consisted of Nos. 454 to 450 Washington Street; the first of which was the corner property and also bore No. 147 Watts Street.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, as viewed from Washington Street and showing in the foreground that frontage. The structure marked "Towers" is a 5-story warehouse, No. 281-85 West Street, at the N.E. corner of Watts Street.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Watts Street & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Watts Street, at Washington Street, showing freight yards.
(2) Watts Street, southeast corner and Washington Street, looking across clearing at southwest corner eastwards.

P. L. Sperr                     January 6, 1941
Views 1,2
